result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry D Klatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" after 24 months of Initial Confinement.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 24 months of Initial Confinement.
 
This sentence is to commence forthwith

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $275 drug testing fee
--to pay $625 for buy money reimbursement

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least once per month upon release from prison for first 6 months)
--obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--No Contact with Christy English (a/k/a Scheiber) or Paul Miller
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
Proposed Order for Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on March 27, 2015 before the Honorable Judge O'Brien

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:22pm [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Larry D Klatt in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Klatt 

On Counts #1, #2, & #3 The Court sentences Mr. Klatt to  6  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years, concurrent on each of the counts.  This sentence is to commence forthwith. 


The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" after 24 months of Initial Confinement.
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 24 months of Initial Confinement.
 

The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling  as required by the Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least once per month upon release from prison for first 6 months)
--obtain/ maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--No Contact with Christy English (a/k/a Scheiber) or Paul Miller
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3 to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $275 drug testing fee
--to pay $625 for buy money reimbursement

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess:1:34pm
Sentencing hearing on March 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Scheduling notice
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:47am [mo]
Defendant Larry D Klatt in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered Counts #1, #2, #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #4 and #5.
The Court confirms Mr. Klatt's current address on file

recess: 10:55am

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing: 3/27/15 at 1:15
State's with cover letter
Status conference on March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 4, 2015 at 11:20 am.
Scheduling notice

Reserve Judge Klossner presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 1:44pm [MK]
Defendant Larry D Klatt in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Klatt waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--the Information is filed and a copy of the Information is provided to Attorney Dahnert, reading is waived
--the Court indicates that the charges and maximum penalties are the same as in the Criminal Complaint
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--Attorney Dahnert indicates that the Defense is "waiving speedy trial"
The Court continues the Bond.
recess 1:48pm. 


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/4/15 at 11:20am   (2) Status Conference on 3/13/15 at 10:00am
Attorney Dahnert
Preliminary hearing on January 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 2:10 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for Preliminary Hearing)
Defendant Larry D Klatt in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews letter submitted by Atty Svehlek & indicates copy was provided to DA Happ
DA Happ: Not in position to object; did cancel witness as was notified by Counsel of request
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Mr. Klatt is still eligible for services & will appoint in 48 - 72 hours; requests matter be reset in 7 - 10 days
Court allows Atty Svehlek to withdraw from case & withdraws currently schedule DA PTC & STC
Court reminds Mr. Klatt that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 2:14 pm 

NEXT: (1) Reschedule Preliminary Hearing 1/30/15 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Letter from SPD ref non-waivable conflict w/cover letter
Court concludes RFS is timely & in proper form. Court directs Clerk to request the assignment of another Judge under Wis Stat. 971.20(3)(b)
Preliminary hearing on January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Submitted by Attorney Svehlek
Court orders that preliminary hearing occur at date/time no later than 1/9/15, the date of the w/drawl of the stipulation became effective. cc: All
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
from State re: request for speedy prelim. & request to leave DA PTC as scheduled
Defendant's
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Status conference on February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch III Intake: 
case called at 1:16pm. [MK]
Defendant Larry D Klatt appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $20,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with Paul Miller or Christy Scheiber, except through a lawyer
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--no possession or ingestion of illegal drugs
--no possession of drug paraphernalia

Attorney Svehlek indicates that the Defendant indicates that his proper name is:  Larry D. Klatt II. 
The Court informs the parties that this case is currently assigned to Judge Weston, however as of January 1st, the case will be assigned to Branch III/Judge Wambach.
recess 1:25pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/28/15 at 10:00am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing in Branch III on a date after the Pretrial Conference
